As part of the action to cast this spell you may tug on these strands around a creature of your choice wihtin the spell's range, that creature must make a wisdom saving throw, taking 1d10 necrotic + 1d10 force damage on a successful save or half as much on a failed save. For as long as you continue concentrating on this spell you can see magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If these effects are a spell you automatically know the spell’s level. You can make an arcana check to identify extra traits about the spell. Use the table below to determine what you learn about the spell. (creatures with spellcasting or proficiency in arcana can help you on this check) DC Effect 5 + the spell’s level You learn the spell’s duration and school 10 + the spell’s level You learn the spell’s effect 15 + the spell’s level You learn the spell’s name and identify the magical signature of the caster, if you ever see any other spells cast by the same creature you can immediately identify it as such. If the magical effect is not a spell, you learn the spell's range and the DM determines any other information you are able to learn.

name: Leyline Attunement
description: Attune to the natural magic around you. As part of the bonus action to cast this spell you can dodge, dash, disengage, or hide. For as long as you continue concentrating on this spell you can see magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If these effects are a spell you automatically know the spell's level. You can make an arcana check to identify extra traits about the spell. Use the table below to determine what you learn about the spell. (creatures with spellcasting or proficiency in arcana can help you on this check) DC Effect 5 + the spell’s level You learn the spell’s duration and school 10 + the spell’s level You learn the spell’s effect 15 + the spell’s level You learn the spell’s name and know the type of creature that cast the spell, if they are humanoid you know their species. If the magical effect is not a spell, you learn the spell's range and the DM determines any other information you are able to learn.

name: Mannakar’s Gift of Tongues
description: You are bestowed with the chorus of the damned and the ability to understand it. For the duration of the spell you can understand and write any language. Your magic is imbued with the wretched wailing. Once per turn for the duration of the spell, whenever you hit a creature with a spell attack roll that deals damage, you can deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage to the target.

name: Call Lightning
description: Summon lightning. If you are outside you may summon a stormcloud in the sky above you within range. When you cast this spell and as an action for the duration, you may have a a creature within range make a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure they take 4d8 lightning damage and gain 2 levels of shocked. If you are already in a storm when you cast this spell you gain control of it and this spell deals an additional 2d8 damage.

name: Gaseous Form
castTime: 1 reaction, in response to being hit by an attack roll or 1 action
duration: Until the end of your next turn.
description: You become a cloud of gas causing any triggering attacks to miss. While you are a cloud of gas you gain the following benefits: You cannot be targeted by attack rolls You cannot use any of the items you had before transforming You gain resistance to all damage types You have advantage on strength, dexterity, and constitution saving throws You can squeeze through small holes and narrow openings but must treat liquids as solid objects You can move through the spaces of other creatures The first time you move through a creature or a creature moves through you each turn, you may have that creature take 1d4 acid damage and gain 1 level of corroded for 10 minutes. As an action you can expand to encompass a 30 foot sphere and form beads of acid, you may choose any amount of creatures you encompass and force them to make a dexterity saving throw, taking 6d4 acid damage and gaining 1 level of corroded for 10 minutes or half as much damage on a success.

name: ph_boneshield
castTime: 1 reaction, in response to being hit by an attack roll or 1 action
description: When you cast this spell take [2d10 + your spellcasting modifier] necrotic damage. You gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the damage you took times 3 until the spell ends. When you lose these temporary hit points you may have the bones shatter and explode outward forcing each creature within 15 ft of you to make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take 3d8 slashing damage and half as much on a success. On your next turn you can end this spell as a bonus action, otherwise the spell ends at the start of the turn after.

name: Windwall
castTime: 1 reaction to a creature you can see making a ranged attack roll, or a bonus action
description: When you cast this spell create a 40 foot long, 15 foot tall, 5 foot wide wall of rushing wind. Ranged attack rolls between creatures on different sides of this wall automatically miss if the roll is less than your spell save DC + the spell’s level + 3. The wall is difficult terrain, when a creature tries to walk through the wall it must make a strength saving throw. On a failure the creature must take 4d8 slashing damage or be pushed back 10 feet. After 1 round, this spell ends at the start of your next turn.

name: Golden Lasso of Alseiss
description: You create a gleaming lasso in your hands. When you cast this spell and as an action on each of your turns for the duration, you may make a melee spell attack against a creature within range, on a hit the creature takes 2d10 force damage and is grappled. To escape the grapple a creature must use its action to make an acrobatics or athletics check and beat your spell save DC. As an action you can also lasso objects that are large or smaller and weigh less than 200 pounds. You grapple any amount of objects or creatures this way, if an object or creature leaves the spells range they are immediately no longer grappled As a bonus action you can pull a grappled object or creature up to 15 feet towards you and you may deal 1d10 force damage to the creature or object. When you pull an object in this way, if you have a container it would fit in on your person; you may instead have it teleport into the container.

name: Tidal Wave
description: Create a 30 foot long 10 foot wide 10 foot tall line starting anywhere within the spells range, a tidal wave rushes through that space forcing each creature within to make a constitution saving throw against your spell save. On a failure they take 3d12 impact damage and take 2 levels of staggered, on a success they take half as much damage and 1 level of staggered.

name: Blizzard
description: Create a 40 ft radius, 20 ft tall cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. Creatures that start their turn in, or enter this are for the first time on their turn, must make a constitution saving throw taking 2d6 cold damage and gaining 2 slowed levels on a failed save, and half as much damage on a success.

name: Vampiric Touch
description: As part of the action to cast this spell and as an action on future turns for the duration of the spell you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit deal [2d10 + the spell’s level] necrotic damage and heal an amount equal to half the damage dealt.

name: Thunder Step
description: You teleport yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range. Choose to create a sphere at your previous location, or your destination; Each other creature within 15 feet of the space you left must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d12 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The thunder can be heard from up to 300 feet away.

name: Spirit Guardians
description: You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creatureâ€™s speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 radiant damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

name: Pearlescent Spire
description: Choose an unnocupied space to summon a gleaming obelisk from Celestia. The obelisk is a construct and takes up one 5 foot space and grows as tall as it can up to 50 feet. The top of the obelisk ends in a point and cannot be stood on. The obelisk has an AC equal to your spell save DC and an amount of HP equal to the spell's level times the spell's level times 3. If the obelisk is reduced to 0 hit points it dissapears and the spell ends. When you cast this spell all enemy creatures within 30 feet of the obelisk gain 1 level of exhaustion for the duration of the spell and must make a constituition saving throw, taking 2d8 radiant damage on a fail and half as much on a success. Whenever an enemy creature starts it's turn within 30 feet of the obelisk or enters that space for the first time on it's turn it must make a constituition saving throw, gaining 1 level of exhaustion for the duration of the spell on a failure. Enemy creatures moving away from the obelisk while within 30 feet of it, must use 10 feet of movement for every 5 feet of distance they cover.

name: Hanera's Hollow Needles
description: Choose up to 3 creatures within range, each creature must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failure they take 1d10 piercing damage, gain an amount of exposed equal to this spell's level, and are threaded for the duration of the spell. On a failed save they take half as much damage. Whenever a threaded creature would lose a level of exposed, that creature gains a level instead. Whenever a threaded creature takes damage from the exposed condition, all threaded creatures take that damage. As a bonus action on future turns you can choose an unthreaded creature within the spell's range, that creature must make a dexterity saving throw against the spell's initial effect.

name: ph_slash
description: Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you, on a hit the creature takes 10d8 slashing damage.

name: ph_unleashedSwarm
description: Tear open a portal to the shadowfell and unleash a swarm of mites unto your foes. When you cast this spell each creature in a 10 foot radius sphere must make a constitution saving throw, gaining 1 level of decay on a failure. As a bonus action for the duration of the spell you can force a single creature within range to make a constitution saving throw, gaining 2 levels of decayed on a failure and 1 level of decayed on a success.

name: Antagonize
description: Choose a creature within the spell’s range. It must make a wisdom saving throw, on a failure it takes 6d4 psychic damage and must make a melee attack against a creature of your choice. If the creature cannot make this attack, either due to no creatures in range or no reactions, it instead gains confusion until the start of your next turn. On a success it takes half as much damage.

name: Bloated Poxsacks
description: Summon floating balls of toxin from the underdark. Create an amount equal to this spells level. For each ball choose to have it appear on your person or on any unoccupied space within the spell’s range. The Poxsacks that appear within the spell’s range activate when a creature enters its space. You may have a Poxsack activate whenever a creature walks within 5 feet of it. As an action you may throw a Poxsack on your person at a creature within 60 feet of you. When you do it activates on that creature’s space. You can carefully hand them to other willing creatures on your turn as a bonus action, those creatures can then throw them as an action. When a poxsack activates it bursts into a toxic cloud. All creatures within 5 feet of it must make a constitution saving throw, gaining 2 levels of poison on a failure or 1 level on a success. If the poxsacks have not activated after 10 minutes they deflate and become inert.

name: Fireball
description: Choose a point within range, each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failure they take 7d6 fire damage and on a success they talk half as much.

name: Fear
description: Project terrifying images forward from yourself. Each creature in a 30 foot cone in front of you must make an intelligence saving throw. On a failure they are frightened of you for the duration of the spell. As long as they remain frightened they must spend all of their movement each turn moving away from you. If they end their turn out of your line of sight, they can make an intelligence saving throw to end the frightened condition. On a successful save the creature cannot willing move closer to you on their next turn.

name: Fly
description: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration.

name: Hypnotic Pattern
description: You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes stunned for the duration. The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

name: Magic Circle
description: You create a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-tall cylinder of magical energy centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range. Glowing runes appear wherever the cylinder intersects with the floor or other surface. Choose one or more of the following types of creatures: celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead. The circle affects a creature of the chosen type in the following ways: The creature can’t willingly enter the cylinder by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to do so, it must first succeed on a Charisma saving throw. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets within the cylinder. Targets within the cylinder can’t be charmed, frightened, or possessed by the creature. When you cast this spell, you can elect to cause its magic to operate in the reverse direction, preventing a creature of the specified type from leaving the cylinder and protecting targets outside it. When you cast this spell you can choose to create the circle without any of it’s effects activating. If you do, you can activate it’s effects at any time as a reaction to a creature you can see or hear entering the magic circle.
